title: Menza Score
description: Predicts 4-year HIV risk for men who have sex with men (MSM) based on sexual behavior and substance use factors. Developed to help identify high-risk individuals for targeted HIV prevention interventions.

parameters.name: sti_history
parameters.description: History of gonorrhea, chlamydia, or syphilis

parameters.name: meth_nitrite_use
parameters.description: Methamphetamine or inhaled nitrite (poppers) use in the prior 6 months

parameters.name: unprotected_anal_intercourse
parameters.description: Unprotected anal intercourse with HIV-positive or unknown status partner in the prior year

parameters.name: ten_plus_partners
parameters.description: 10 or more male sexual partners in the prior year

result.name: menza_score
result.description: Total Menza Score indicating HIV risk level

ranges.interpretation: Low risk for HIV acquisition over the next 4 years. Continue routine HIV screening and preventive counseling. Discuss general HIV prevention strategies.
Moderate risk for HIV acquisition. Consider discussing pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) and intensified HIV prevention counseling. Regular HIV testing recommended.
High risk for HIV acquisition. Strongly consider pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) initiation. Provide comprehensive HIV prevention counseling and frequent HIV testing.
Very high risk for HIV acquisition. Pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) strongly recommended. Implement intensive HIV prevention interventions and very frequent HIV testing.

references: Menza TW, Hughes JP, Celum CL, Golden MR. Prediction of HIV acquisition among men who have sex with men. Sex Transm Dis. 2009 Sep;36(9):547-55.
Luo Q, Dong Y, Chen H, et al. Factors Associated with HIV Infection among Men Who Have Sex with Men: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis. Arch Sex Behav. 2023;52(5):2293-2322.

Jones J, Hoenigl M, Siegler AJ, et al. Assessing the Performance of 3 Human Immunodeficiency Virus Incidence Risk Scores in a Cohort of Black and White Men Who Have Sex With Men in the South. Sex Transm Dis. 2017 May;44(5):297-302.
formula: Menza Score = STI history (0 or 4 points) + Meth/nitrite use (0 or 11 points) + Unprotected anal intercourse (0 or 1 point) + 10+ partners (0 or 3 points)
notes: Should only be used for assessing risk in men who have sex with men (MSM)
Should not be the sole tool used to determine the need for pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Validation studies noted decreased sensitivity for Black MSM
Consider local HIV epidemiology and individual patient factors when interpreting results
